response:
## Answer

Across these documents, the “who pays what” can be summarized as follows:

- **Holding Tank Servicing Contract:**  
  - The **Owner (Contoso Ltd.)** must pay the **Pumper (Fabrikam Inc.)** all charges incurred for servicing the holding tank(s), on terms mutually agreed between them. [1], [13]  
  - The Owner must also maintain the access road/drive at their own expense so the Pumper can service the tanks. [13]  
  - No taxes or government fees are explicitly allocated to either party in this contract. [1], [13]

- **Purchase Contract for Vertical Platform Lift (Contoso Lifts LLC – Fabrikam Inc.):**  
  - The **Customer (Fabrikam Inc.)** must pay the **Contractor (Contoso Lifts LLC.)** a total contract price of **$29,900.00**, in three installments: $20,000 upon signing, $7,000 upon delivery, and $2,900 upon completion. [2], [12]  
  - If the Customer defaults on payment, the Contractor may take legal action and recover legal fees from the Customer. [2], [12]  
  - For permitting, the Contractor only assists; the **Customer bears any additional compliance costs** (e.g., extra costs to meet code or permit requirements). [2], [11]  
  - The contract does not separately list sales tax; the total price is stated as $29,900.00 without a tax breakdown. [2], [12]

- **Contoso Lifts Invoice (to Fabrikam Construction / John Doe):**  
  - The **Customer (Fabrikam Construction / John Doe)** is billed a **subtotal of $29,900.00**, with **TAX listed as “N/A”**, so the **total and amount due are $29,900.00**. [4], [5], [18]  
  - Payment is due “on contract signing,” aligning with the initial payment requirement in the contract. [4], [5]  
  - The invoice instructs that all checks be made payable to **Contoso Lifts LLC**, so the Customer pays Contoso Lifts LLC directly. [4], [5]

- **Property Management Agreement (Hawaii rental property):**  
  - The **Owner** must pay the **Agent** a **non‑refundable start‑up fee of $250.00 upon execution** of the agreement. [8], [9], [19]  
  - The Owner must pay a **management fee/commission** to the Agent:  
    - **25% of gross revenues** for short‑term/vacation rentals (reservations < 180 days). [15], [16], [17]  
    - **10% of gross revenues** for long‑term leases (leases > 180 days). [15], [16], [21]  
  - The Owner must pay a **pro‑ration charge for advertising** for short‑term/vacation rentals at **$75.00 per month**. [14], [15], [21]  
  - The Owner must pay a **minimum administration and accounting charge of $50.00 per month** (excluding tax preparation/returns/forms). [14], [20], [21]  
  - For repairs, upgrades, and renovations:  
    - The Owner pays a **fee of 10% of the total charge** for such work to the Agent. [14], [20]  
    - The Owner pays a **$35/hour charge** for the Agent’s time to schedule or escort contractors, repair persons, technicians, and handymen. [8], [20]  
  - The Agent is allowed to **accept credit cards and deduct credit card/bankcard fees from the Owner’s proceeds**, meaning the Owner effectively bears those transaction costs. [16], [17]  
  - The **Owner must also pay Hawaii Gross Excise Tax (currently 4.712%)** on **all the Agent’s fees, commissions, and charges** listed above. [8], [9]  
  - For advertising, the Agent pays the media invoices and then **passes the advertising cost on to the Owner** via the monthly proceeds statements. [10]

## Details

- **Holding Tank Servicing Contract – Cost Allocation**  
  - The Owner agrees “to have the holding tank(s) serviced by the pumper” and “further agrees to pay the pumper for all charges incurred in servicing the holding tank(s) as mutually agreed upon by the owner and pumper.” [1], [13]  
  - The Owner must “maintain the all‑weather access road or drive so that the pumper can service the holding tank(s) with the pumping equipment,” implying the Owner bears those maintenance costs. [13]  
  - The Pumper’s obligations are reporting and compliance (submitting service reports to the County), not payment of service fees; the contract does not state that the Pumper pays any fees to the Owner. [1], [3], [13]

- **Lift Purchase Contract – Fees, Charges, and Risk**  
  - The total contract price is explicitly stated as “$29,900.00, payable in 3 installments: $20,000.00 upon signing; $7,000.00 upon delivery; $2,900.00 upon completion,” which the Customer must pay to the Contractor. [2], [12]  
  - “Failure to pay may result in legal action. Legal fees are recoverable by Contractor,” so if the Customer defaults, the Customer ultimately pays the Contractor’s legal fees. [2], [12]  
  - Under “Permitting,” “Contractor assists with permitting. Customer bears any additional compliance costs,” so any extra costs to meet code or permit requirements are paid by the Customer, not the Contractor. [2], [11]  
  - The contract is governed by Florida law, but no specific tax obligations are itemized; the price is a lump sum. [2]

- **Contoso Lifts Invoice – Amounts and Tax Treatment**  
  - The invoice lists line items totaling a **SUBTOTAL of 29,900.00** for the lift, power system, cab, outdoor fitting, door, and hall call stations. [4], [5], [18]  
  - The **TAX line is “N/A”**, and both **TOTAL** and **AMOUNT DUE** are **29,900.00**, indicating no separate tax is charged on this invoice. [4], [5], [18]  
  - Terms state “Due on contract signing,” so the Customer must pay this amount at signing. [4], [5]  
  - The invoice directs: “Make all checks payable to Contoso Lifts LLC,” so the Customer pays Contoso Lifts LLC. [4], [5]

- **Property Management Agreement – Owner‑Paid Fees and Taxes**  
  - Start‑up: “Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Owner shall pay two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) to the Agent as a non‑refundable start‑up fee,” used for initial administrative expenses, inventory, and inspection. [8], [9], [19]  
  - Management commissions:  
    - “A fee/commission of twenty five percent (25%) of the gross revenues for management services for short term and/or vacation rentals (reservations of less than 180 days).” [15], [16], [17]  
    - “A fee/commission of ten percent (10%) of the gross revenues for management services for long term leases (leases of more than 180 days).” [15], [16], [21]  
  - Advertising: “A pro‑ration charge for advertising for short‑term (vacation rentals), at $75.00/month.” [14], [15], [21]  
  - Administration/accounting: “A minimum charge for administration and accounting, at $50.00/month (not to include tax preparation/returns/forms).” [14], [20], [21]  
  - Repairs/renovations:  
    - “A fee of ten percent (10%) on the total charge for repairs, upgrades, and/or renovations.” [14], [20]  
    - “A charge of $35/hour to schedule repairs, upgrades, renovations, replacement of appliances, carpets, curtains, drapes, and/or to escort the contractors, repair persons, technicians and handymen.” [8], [20]  
  - Credit card/bankcard fees: “Agent is allowed by Owner to accept credit cards and to deduct for credit card and/or bankcard fees from the Owner’s proceeds,” so these fees are effectively paid by the Owner. [16], [17]  
  - Hawaii Gross Excise Tax: “Plus, the Agent will assess/charge the Owner the Hawaii Gross Excise tax (currently at 4.712%) on all the above fees, commissions and charges,” so the Owner pays this tax on every fee/commission/charge the Agent imposes. [8], [9]  
  - Advertising pass‑through: The Agent will “Provide the invoice(s) from the media, and pay the charges and pass on the cost to the Owner, on the monthly proceeds statements,” so the Owner ultimately pays the advertising costs. [10]

metadata.llm_context:
=== DOCUMENT: HOLDING TANK SERVICING CONTRACT === [1] # HOLDING TANK SERVICING CONTRACT Contract Date: 2024-06-15 This contract is made between the Holding Tank Owner and the Pumper. 1\. The owner agrees to file a copy of this contract with the County of Washburn, as required under WI Code SPS 383.21(2)5. 2\. The owner agrees to have the holding tank(s) serviced by the pumper and guarantees to permit the pumper to have access and to enter upon the property for the purpose of servicing the holding tank(s). The owner agrees to maintain the all-weather access road or drive so that the pumper can service the holding tank(s) with the pumping equipment. The owner further agrees to pay the pumper for a charges incurred in servicing the holding tank(s) as mutually agreed upon by the owner and pumper. 3\. The pumper agrees to submit to the County, reports for the servicing of the holding tank(s) in manner specified by the County. The pumper further agrees to include the following in the report: a. The name and address of the person responsible for servicing the holding tank; b. The name of the owner of the holding tank; c. The location of the property on which the holding tank is installed; d. The sanitary permit number issued for the holding tank; e. The dates on which the holding tank was serviced; f. The volumes in gallons of the contents pumped from the holding tank for each servicing; g. The disposal sites to which the contents from the holding tank were delivered. h. Condition of holding tank and components at time of inspection. 4\. This agreement will remain in effect until the owner or pumper terminates this contract. In the event of a change in this contract, the owner agrees to file a copy of any changes to this service contract or a copy of a new service contract with the municipality and the County named above within ten (10) business days from the date of change to this service contract.
Owner(s) Names(s) (Print) Owner's Signature(s)
Contoso Ltd. Contoso
Pumper's Name (Print) Fabrikam Inc. Pumper's Signature Fabrikam
Pumper's Registration Number REG-54321
[13] The owner agrees to maintain the all-weather access road or drive so that the pumper can service the holding tank(s) with the pumping equipment. The owner further agrees to pay the pumper for a charges incurred in servicing the holding tank(s) as mutually agreed upon by the owner and pumper. The pumper agrees to submit to the County, reports for the servicing of the holding tank(s) in manner specified by the County. === DOCUMENT: purchase_contract === [2] # PURCHASE CONTRACT This contract is entered into by and between Contoso Lifts LLC. (Contractor), located at , P.O. Box 123567 Key West, FL. 33304-0708, and Fabrikam Inc. (Customer), located at 61 S 34th Street, Dayton, FL 33155. This contract is effective upon mutual signature and initial payment. ## 1. Scope of Work Contractor agrees to furnish and install the following: · 1 Vertical Platform Lift (AscendPro VPX200) · 1 Power system: 110 VAC 60 Hz up, 12 VAC down . 1 Custom cab 42" x 62" with Type 3 90-degree access · 1 Outdoor configuration package · 1 Aluminum door with plexi-glass inserts & automatic opener · 2 Flush-mount Hall Call stations (upper & lower) ## 2. Payment Terms Total contract price is $29,900.00, payable in 3 installments: · $20,000.00 upon signing · $7,000.00 upon delivery · $2,900.00 upon completion ## 3. Changes Any changes must be agreed to in writing and will affect the next payment milestone. ### 4. Customer Default Failure to pay may result in legal action. Legal fees are recoverable by Contractor. ### 5. Risk of Loss Contractor holds risk until delivery. Customer holds risk thereafter. ## 6. Delivery Delivery expected 8-10 weeks after drawing approval. Delay causes include factory and permits. ## 7. Applicable Law This contract shall be governed by the laws of the State of Florida. ## 8. Assignment Neither party may assign this contract without the other's written consent. ## 9. Warranty Manufacturer warranty applies. Contractor warrants labor for 90 days. ## 10. Permitting Contractor assists with permitting. Customer bears any additional compliance costs. ### 11. Right to Cancel Customer may cancel within 3 business days for full refund. Afterward, deposit is forfeited. ## 1.
